intro: Thlaspi incanum, commonly known as hoary whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as broccoli and mustard. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Thlaspi incanum is often found in tundra and mountainous areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
